1. These Regulations may be cited as the Water Environment (Abstractions 

and Associated Impoundments) (Licensing Fees) Regulations 2024.

title: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Water Environment (Abstractions
heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 29th August 2024.
text_raw:
2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 29th August 2024. 

Definitions
text_norm: 2 regulation shall come operation 29th august 2024 definition

title: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Water Environment (Abstractions
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations— 

“Agency” means the Environmental Protection Agency; 

“licence” means an abstraction licence applied for to, or granted by, the Agency 
in accordance with Part 5 or 6 of the Water Environment (Abstractions and 
Associated Impoundments) Act 2022 (No. 48 of 2022). 

Fee for application for licence
text_norm: 2 regulations-- agency mean environmental protection agency licence mean abstraction licence applied granted agency accordance part 5 6 water environment (abstractions associated impoundments) act 2022 (no 48 2022) fee application licence

title: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Water Environment (Abstractions
heading: 3. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), an applicant for a licence shall pay to the
text_raw:
3. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), an applicant for a licence shall pay to the 
Agency the fee referred to in column (2), opposite the mention of the relevant 
class of abstraction in column (1), of the Schedule. 

(2) The Agency may, at its sole discretion, having had regard to the 
circumstances of the case, reduce or waive, by whatever amount it considers 
appropriate, a fee payable under paragraph (1). 

Fee payable for application to review conditions to which licence is subject
text_norm: 3 (1) subject paragraph (2) applicant licence shall pay agency fee referred column (2) opposite mention relevant class abstraction column (1) schedule (2) agency may sole discretion regard circumstance case reduce waive whatever amount considers appropriate fee payable paragraph (1) fee payable application review condition licence subject

title: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Water Environment (Abstractions
heading: 4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), an applicant for the review of conditions to
text_raw:
4. (1) Subject to paragraph (2), an applicant for the review of conditions to 
which a licence is subject shall pay to the Agency the fee referred to in column 
(3), opposite the mention of the relevant class of abstraction in column (1), of 
the Schedule. 

(2) The Agency may, at its sole discretion, having had regard to the 
circumstances of the case, reduce or waive, by whatever amount it considers 
appropriate, a fee payable under paragraph (1). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 30th August, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [418] 3

title: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Water Environment (Abstractions
heading: 5. An applicant for the surrender of a licence shall pay to the Agency the
text_raw:
5. An applicant for the surrender of a licence shall pay to the Agency the 
fee referred to in column (4), opposite the mention of the relevant class of 
abstraction in column (1), of the Schedule. 

Fee payable for application to transfer licence or revised licence
text_norm: 5 applicant surrender licence shall pay agency fee referred column (4) opposite mention relevant class abstraction column (1) schedule fee payable application transfer licence revised licence

title: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Water Environment (Abstractions
heading: 6. An applicant for the transfer of a licence or a revised licence shall pay to
text_raw:
6. An applicant for the transfer of a licence or a revised licence shall pay to 
the Agency the fee referred to in column (5), opposite the mention of the relevant 
class of abstraction in column (1), of the Schedule. 

Fee for enforcement of licence 

7 (1) Subject to paragraph (2), the Agency may, from time to time, specify 
a fee that it considers appropriate to be charged by the Agency and paid by a 
licensee to discharge the costs incurred by the Agency— 

(a) 

(b) 

in determining whether there has been compliance with any 
conditions attached to a licence, 

in relation to any steps taken for the purpose of monitoring an 
abstraction, or 

(c) otherwise reasonably incurred in relation to an abstraction. 

(2) A fee charged by the Agency under paragraph (1) shall not, in any case, 
exceed the amount actually incurred by the Agency in respect of the items 
mentioned in paragraph (1)(a) to (c), as the case may be. 

Contract debts

title: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Water Environment (Abstractions
heading: 8. The Agency may recover, from the person by whom it is payable, an
text_raw:
8. The Agency may recover, from the person by whom it is payable, an 
amount due in respect of fees under these Regulations as a simple contract debt 
in any court of competent jurisdiction 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [418]
